intro: Isopogon nutans, commonly known as the drooping banksia, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its dense, cylindrical inflorescences that droop from the stems, producing yellow to orange flowers. The plant has narrow, leathery leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern around the stems. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to full sun exposure. Isopogon nutans is often found in coastal and sandy habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native environment.
